poem:
Title: Ultimatum at Dawn

Columbia's waking cry, a biting claw,
Ignored, the children of a distant shore,
They pitched tents of resistance, refused to flee,
Endowed by scholarly spirits, simply willing to be.
Edicts, woven by unseen hands in shadowed halls, 
Cold as stone, fell silent on their rustic walls.
A university, a battlefield, a phrase unsaid,
In the hearts of the suspended, the idea is never dead.
